wikipedia_page.main: Philip Arditti also credited as Philip Ishak Arditti, is a Turkish theatre and television actor of Jewish Sephardic descent, famous for his role as Uday Hussein in the four episode House of Saddam television docudrama. He also appeared in the film Red 2, a sequel to 2010's Red. He was part of the team that founded the Arcola Theatre in London

response: * Philip Arditti (born c. 1980), British/Jewish Sephardic theatre and television actorIMDb Database  retrieved 23 December 2018.

Philip Arditti played Uday in the miniseries House of Saddam. He and Latif were portrayed by Dominic Cooper in The Devil's Double, based on Latif's memories, "I was Saddam's Son", but according to Latif had only been "20% of the truth". Hrach Titizian played him in the play Bengal Tiger at the Baghdad Zoo. Sam Vincenti played him in the Locked Up Abroad tv-series, in the 2013 episode "Son of Saddam".

response: * Philip Arditti as Uday Hussein, Saddam's eldest son
* Philip Arditti as Saleh Al-Zahid, a Palestinian who commits malevolent acts towards the Stein family for reasons eventually revealed.

response: * 05-09 – Then They Came for Me by Maziar Bahari, read by Philip Arditti and Peter Hamilton Dyer.
* Philip Arditti as Rodrigo de Puebla, the Spanish ambassador

The play opened at the Royal National Theatre on 15 September 2017, again directed by Sher, with Toby Stephens, Lydia Leonard, Peter Polycarpou and Philip Arditti as the lead performers, before transferring to the West End's Harold Pinter Theatre from 2 October until 30 December.
